message.content: This question requires some basic knowledge about the properties of different materials. When a human pushes on a plastic dinner container, the container is deformable and will visibly alter in shape. Options (A), (B), and (D) are incorrect because a human pushing on a manly sculpture, an inhumanly tall building, or the standard burning sun would not cause a visible alteration in their shapes.

This question requires understanding of physical properties and the ability of a human to exert force on objects. By pushing on a plastic dinner container, a human can cause a visible alteration in the shape of it. Plastic is a malleable material that can be easily deformed by applying force. Option (A) is incorrect because a sculpture, unless made of a malleable material, would not be easily altered by pushing on it. Option (B) is incorrect because a tall building is made of rigid materials that would not easily deform by pushing on it. Option (D) is incorrect because the shape of the sun cannot be visibly altered by a human pushing on it.

Options (A), (B), and (D) are incorrect because sculptures, buildings, and the sun are not typically made of materials that can be easily altered by pushing on them.
